fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bamboo does not link to JIRA, when the comment has a "-"(hyphen) after the JIRA issue key.

When we create a branch, which is a "JIRA-KEY" + "-" + "text" E.g. TEST-2-AA -- Bamboo will build the branch, but it does not link to JIRA.

h3. Environment
* Integrate JIRA, Bitbucket and Bamboo

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a branch in Bitbucket. ex) bugfix/TEST-2-AA. 
#* TEST-2 is the JIRA Key. 
#* TEST-2-AA is the branch name.
# Merge a pull request in Bitbucket. 
#* Commit message: "Merge pull request #2 in TEST/test from bugfix TEST-2-AA to master"
# Build this commit in Bamboo.

h3. Expected Results

The comment has a JIRA key, it should be linked to JIRA.

h3. Actual Results

It is not linked to JIRA.
 !notlinked.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Bamboo does not link to JIRA, when the comment has "-"(hyphen) after the JIRA Key word

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bamboo throws the following error while attempting to export data out of Bamboo:
{code:java}
2016-07-21 14:11:52,858 INFO [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [XmlMigrator] Writing xml to file: C:\bamboo-home\exports\export_bamboo_51020_20160721.zip\db-export\artifacts.xml
2016-07-21 14:11:52,858 INFO [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [XmlMigrator] Exporting with: com.atlassian.bamboo.artifact.ArtifactMapper
2016-07-21 14:11:52,954 INFO [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [XmlMigrator] Ensuring the the file has been unmounted
2016-07-21 14:11:52,955 INFO [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [XmlMigrator] Unmounted C:\bamboo-home\exports\export_bamboo_51020_20160721.zip
2016-07-21 14:11:52,963 INFO [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [ServerLifecycleManagerImpl] Server state changed to 'RUNNING' from 'PAUSED' by 'bamboouser'
2016-07-21 14:11:52,964 ERROR [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [Export] java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.artifact.ArtifactMapper.exportProperties(ArtifactMapper.java:102)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.artifact.ArtifactMapper.exportProperties(ArtifactMapper.java:21)

{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to {{Bamboo administration >> Overview >> System >> Export}}.
 # Click on the *Export* button.
 # Wait for the export process to finish.
h3. Expected Results

The export process writes to the {{artifacts.xml}} file successfully:
{code:java}
2016-07-28 17:29:42,625 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [XmlMigrator] Writing xml to file: /Users/brosa/Documents/Atlassian/restore/sqlserver/bamboo-5.10.3/home/exports/export_restore5103_51020_20160728.zip/db-export/artifacts.xml
2016-07-28 17:29:42,625 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [XmlMigrator] Exporting with: com.atlassian.bamboo.artifact.ArtifactMapper
2016-07-28 17:29:42,716 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [XmlMigrator] Finished writing to file: /Users/brosa/Documents/Atlassian/restore/sqlserver/bamboo-5.10.3/home/exports/export_restore5103_51020_20160728.zip/db-export/artifacts.xml
...

{code}
And reports:
{code:java}
...
2016-07-28 17:30:10,983 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [XmlMigrator] Finished updating zip
2016-07-28 17:30:10,983 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [XmlMigrator] Ensuring the the file has been unmounted
2016-07-28 17:30:10,984 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [XmlMigrator] Unmounted /Users/brosa/Documents/Atlassian/restore/sqlserver/bamboo-5.10.3/home/exports/export_restore5103_51020_20160728.zip
2016-07-28 17:30:10,984 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [XmlMigrator] Export completed. 00:02:55.010

{code}
No error messages in the logs.
h3. Actual Results

The export process fails while trying to export and write the {{artifacts.xml}} file with:
{code:java}
2016-07-21 14:11:52,858 INFO [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [XmlMigrator] Writing xml to file: C:\bamboo-home\exports\export_bamboo_51020_20160721.zip\db-export\artifacts.xml
2016-07-21 14:11:52,858 INFO [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [XmlMigrator] Exporting with: com.atlassian.bamboo.artifact.ArtifactMapper
2016-07-21 14:11:52,954 INFO [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [XmlMigrator] Ensuring the the file has been unmounted
2016-07-21 14:11:52,955 INFO [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [XmlMigrator] Unmounted C:\bamboo-home\exports\export_bamboo_51020_20160721.zip
2016-07-21 14:11:52,963 INFO [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [ServerLifecycleManagerImpl] Server state changed to 'RUNNING' from 'PAUSED' by 'bamboouser'
2016-07-21 14:11:52,964 ERROR [http-apr-8085-exec-5] [Export] java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.artifact.ArtifactMapper.exportProperties(ArtifactMapper.java:102)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.artifact.ArtifactMapper.exportProperties(ArtifactMapper.java:21)

{code}
h3. Workaround

The problem is caused by the {{null}} value assigned to the *ARCHIVER_TYPE* column inside the *ARTIFACT* table. This column does not accept {{null}} values.

It is possible to identify the problem with the following SELECT statement:
{code:java|title=Checking if you are affected by this bug}
select *
  from ARTIFACT
 where ARCHIVER_TYPE is null;

{code}
If the above search return {{null}} values, you can change them to 0 using the following steps:
 # Stop Bamboo.
 # (!) Take a backup of the Bamboo database before moving forward.
 # Run the following SQL query:
{code:java|title=Updating null values to 0}
update ARTIFACT
   set ARCHIVER_TYPE = 0
 where ARCHIVER_TYPE is null;

{code}
 # Start Bamboo.
fields.summary: NullPointerException in Artifatcs when running Export

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a build has been deleted, artifact download task in deployment plan won't be able to use the artifact anymore if S3 artifact handler is configured for plan.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a build plan with artifact definition and run it
 # Create a deployment plan with 2 identical envs and use artifact download task to get the artifact from the above build plan
 # Run the first environment
 # Delete the build result used for version
 # Run the second environment with same version

h3. Expected Results

The artifact can still be used even the build result has been deleted.
h3. Actual Results

The task will fail with:
{noformat}
simple 28-Jul-2016 12:23:36 Preparing to download plan result DELETED_ABC-DFGPLAN27-5 artifact: Shared artifact: [ABC WAR], pattern: [**/*.war]
error 28-Jul-2016 12:23:36 Required storage tag not found in context
error 28-Jul-2016 12:23:36 Unable to download artifact Shared artifact: [ABC WAR], pattern: [**/*.war]

{noformat}
fields.summary: Artifact download failed from S3 after build deleted

fields.description:
It would be nice if the install page for the remote agents note the network capabilities that are needed. This is to explain how the connection between the Bamboo server and the remote agent works and which ports need to be open on the server side.

We have this information inside the [Troubleshooting Remote Agents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMKB/Troubleshooting+Remote+Agents] documentation, but as the name of the doc implies, that is for troubleshooting a problem. I believe we could prevent users from running into such problem if warn them about the required network capabilities in our official install doc.
fields.summary: Add a note about required network capabilities in the remote agent installation docs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a branch plan and release is selected when promoting existing release to this environment, the "Release" selection might auto changed to master plan latest release

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a lot of branch plans and build results
# Deploy a release
# In the Deploy Release page, select promoting existing release to this environment and then choose the correct Plan branch
# Wait for a few seconds before clicking on Start Deployment button

h3. Expected Results
The release is used for the deployment

h3. Actual Results
Incorrect or the latest release from any branch is used in the deployment
 
h3. Notes
* When the page Deploy Release with promoting existing release is loaded, it try to get the list of all the branch plans and its releases and then auto populate the "Release" field with the latest release (created from any branches)
* The problem only happens when there are a lot of branch plans and releases which cause the delay in getting the list
* Even though a branch plan and release are manually selected by the user, the "Release" might auto changed later due to the automation (before the "Start deployment" button is clicked)
* Should disable "Start deployment" button in deployment until page has fully loaded or stop the auto populate function if a manual selection is detected
fields.summary: Release might be deployed with incorrect branch plan

I would like to have the chance to tell bamboo to upload only the new and changed files.
fields.summary: Bamboo SCP support for copying only new and changed files

fields.description: Using 5.8.1 - edit a build plan's job, going to Environment Variables field, and pasting in a UTF-32 character, such as COMBINING ACUTE ACCENT (U+0301).  While the update will be saved to the DB, re-reading the value seems problematic.
fields.summary: UTF-32 character in XML can cause issues

fields.description:
Some customers find that cloning a build plan should also clone the associated deployment plan as an option would be a good improvement for Bamboo.

While Bamboo will allow an deployment environment to be cloned, by default this will still be attached to the original build plan. This is fine when variation on the environment is required. However, some customers will want to "duplicate and transfer" the configuraiton to other plans.. To do this they have to first clone and then go back and edit the association. An improvement for Bamboo could be to make the cloning experience for deployment environments more like build plan cloning and to offer a pulldown of plans that it could be associated with or triggered by. Default behaviour could be to provide an option to clone associated deployment plans if the parent is also cloned.
fields.summary: Clone deployment plan if associated build plan is cloned

fields.description: I have the following in atlassian-plugin.xml
fields.summary: Bamboo

fields.description:
Hello,

Please refer to this use case to rationalize this improvement request.
 # User creates a release candidate from a build (at this point a Bamboo deployment release has been created, e.g. app-1.0.0-rc.1) and promotes it across most deployment environments
 # Once QA and UAT passes, the release candidate is deployed to a "Publish/Production" environment which will strip off the release candidate identifier and build number leaving only the project name and the semver-specific three-digit notation for the version (app-1.0.0)
 # From there, the release is retagged, promoted to stable/staging repositories, deployed to production, etc...

At the end of this procedure, I'm left with a deployment project with a release history full of release candidates but no releases regardless if I had some published to production. I've been meaning to fiddle around step 2 and make mischief with the [bamboo deployment variable|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/bamboo-variables-289277087.html#Bamboovariables-Deploymentvariables] _bamboo.deploy.release_ in an attempt to rename a release but I don't think that will work.

Is this something that can be achieved with a special task or at least a routine I can access within the deployment project to do this?

Kind Regards,
 Daniel
fields.summary: [Deployment Project] Allow renaming of release (reversioning)

*  https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SSHD-738 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
At this stage the cause and steps to reproduce this issue are unknown. 

h3. Excepted Results
Exception is well-handled. 

h3. Actual Results
Under certain circumstances the following errors are found in _atlassian-bamboo.log_:

{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a child plan with an SVN repository detects that the parent plan is using a repository with the same URL the revision is set to the same as the parent it logs the following message to the application logs and not to the build log:

{code}Detected that parent plan 'SVN - SVNPARENT' using the same source. Updating to 9{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create parent plan with SVN repository
# Create child plan with the same SVN repository as parent
# Create the parent -> child dependency
# Build

h3. Expected Results
Log message is displayed in both application and build log.

h3. Actual Results
Log message is displayed only in the application log.
{code}
16:08:28,394 INFO [10-BAM::PlanExec:pool-17-thread-2] [AbstractDependentDetectionAction] : Detected that parent plan 'SVN - SVNPARENT' using the same source. Updating to 9
{code}
fields.summary: "Detected that parent plan using the same source. Updating to <revision>" missing from build log

-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----|{code}
||SSH Passphrase|abc123|
# save it and the same should be found under Bamboo's database, CREDENTIALS table
# run Bamboo export

h3. Expected Results
The Shared Credentials are exported

h3. Actual Results
The Shared Credentials found in the CREDENTIALS table do not exist in Bamboo's export ({{./db-export/credentials.xml}})

h3. Workaround
h4. Scenario A - In place upgrade
If you are upgrading Bamboo and not changing the databases type, version, or location, don't perform an export. Instead, create a Bamboo backup by taking a dump of the database using the native tools specific to your database and create a filesystem copy of the BAMBOO_HOME directory.  For further instructions, refer to the [Bamboo upgrade guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+upgrade+guide] documentation.

h4. Scenario B - Upgrade + DB version upgrade
If you are upgrading Bamboo _and_ changing the databases version, don't perform an export. Instead, create a Bamboo backup by taking a dump of the database using the native tools specific to your database and create a filesystem copy of the BAMBOO_HOME directory. Next, import the database dump into the new version of the database. For further instructions, refer to the [Bamboo upgrade guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+upgrade+guide] documentation.

h4. Scenario C - Upgrade + DB server location change
If you are upgrading Bamboo _and_ changing the databases location, don't perform an export. Instead, create a Bamboo backup by taking a dump of the database using the native tools specific to your database and create a filesystem copy of the BAMBOO_HOME directory. Next, import the database dump into the new database on the new server. For further instructions, refer to the [Bamboo upgrade guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+upgrade+guide] documentation.

h4. Scenario D - Upgrade + DB type change
If you are upgrading Bamboo _and_ changing the database type, you will need to perform an export. After you import the export file into the upgraded version, stop Bamboo and manually copy the data from the CREDENTIALS table from the source (old) database to the target (new) database. For further instructions, refer to the [Bamboo upgrade guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+upgrade+guide] documentation.
fields.summary: Shared Credentials are not exported using Bamboo Export

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Artifact permissions are not preserved for local agents.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a new Project (i.e.: Support), Plan (i.e.: MyPlan)
# add an "{{Script}}" task
{code}
# creates a new file
touch executable.jar

# list files
ls -l

# change its permission
chmod 755 executable.jar

# list files
ls -l
{code}
As a result you would have something like:
{noformat}
12-Dec-2014 14:08:52	total 0
12-Dec-2014 14:08:52	-rw-r--r--  1 root  root  0 Dec 12 14:08 executable.jar
12-Dec-2014 14:08:52	total 0
12-Dec-2014 14:08:52	-rwxr-xr-x  1 root  root  0 Dec 12 14:08 executable.jar
{noformat}
# create an Artifact definition as per following:
{noformat}
Name: myArtifact
Location:
Copy pattern: executable.jar
[x] Shared
{noformat}
# go to *$BAMBOO_HOME/artifacts* and run the following:
{code}
ls -l SUP-MYPLAN/shared/build-00001/myArtifact/executable.jar
{code}
As a result you would have something like:
{noformat}
-rw-r--r--  1 root  root  0 Dec 12 14:08 SUP-MYPLAN/shared/build-00001/myArtifact/executable.jar
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
- Write a script job that will re-set the correct permissions
- Tar everything up before creating the artifacts and then pass around a tarball rather than just pure artifacts.
fields.summary: Artifact permissions are not preserved for local agents

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The bulk action *Update SVN credentials* inside the {{Bamboo administration >> Overview >> Plan >> Bulk action}} page does not work. Credentials are not updated across the repositories associated to the selected plans during the bulk action process. The bulk action feature is described in detail at the [Modifying multiple plans in bulk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Modifying+multiple+plans+in+bulk] documentation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to {{Bamboo administration >> Overview >> Plan >> Bulk action}}.
# Select *Update SVN credentials*.
# Choose the plans you would like to perform the bulk action on.
# Fill in the username/password fields with the new credentials.
# Confirm you want to continue with the update.

The interesting thing is that Bamboo always report the bulk update as being successful.

h3. Expected Results

The credentials for the SVN repositories associated to the plans you selected have been updated to the new ones.

h3. Actual Results
The SVN credentials are not updated. This can result in, for example, Bamboo not being able to access the SVN repositories.

h3.Workaround
Access the {{Bamboo administration >> Linked Repositories}} page to manually update the credentials of the SVN repositories and save the configuration.
fields.summary: Bulk update SVN credentials does not work

fields.description:
Currently notifications for events need to be configured on a plan level.
Some Bamboo administrators would benefit from having global notifications.
Instead of having to configure the notifications for each and every plan, they can be configured just once on a global level.
Clearly this only works for environments where a small administrator team wants to receive all notifications for all plans.
This could be an extension of the already existing 'System level notifications" functionality.
fields.summary: Global notifications

fields.description:
To see the available agents for a plan:
- Go to the build result summary page, which shows "Agent <agent name>" among other things.
- Click on "<agent name>", which results in a page with stats of this agent.
- In the top left of the screen it shows "Agents summary › <agent name> (Local)".
- Click on "Agents summary".

Corresponding URL is http://<server>:8085/agent/viewAgents.action

A user without admin rights could do this in 5.7.2.
In 5.12.3.1 it gives an "Access denied".
fields.summary: Users without admin permission are no longer able to see available agents of plans

fields.description: There is finally a new long term support Ubuntu version, 16.04.  Many people stick to the LTS versions; 14.04 was the previous one. Now that 16.04 is out, we'd like to upgrade our apps to it for better docker support and other features.  Therefore we'd like a stock Bamboo elastic image that is based on Ubuntu 16.04.
fields.summary: Elastic agent support for Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When loading repositories from GitHub, repositories that exist underneath an Organization are displayed twice

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Organization on GitHub
# Create a test repository under the Organization
# Add a new Linked repository to Bamboo:
## Select the type of GitHub and enter your credentials
## Click Load Repositories 


h3. Expected Results
Org repositories should display once

h3. Actual Results
Org repositories display twice
fields.summary: GitHub Organization repositories display twice

Actual: stack trace without any navigation
fields.summary: FTL stacktrace when navigate to not existing environment details

fields.description:
When Bamboo posts a build to Bitbucket Server, it isn't always posting a direct link to the build. Sometimes, it just posts a link to the branch. I can't figure out the pattern for when it only posts to the branch and not the actual build. It still posts the build number in the REST response, so Bitbucket Server can say "Build #5 successful" but the URL doesn't go straight to build 5.
h4. Original report

Ref: [https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/OE/repos/one/commits?until=refs/heads/OE-2471-yolo-upgrade-test]

The builds url points to [https://engservices-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/OE-ONE425], but it should be [https://engservices-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/OE-ONE-425] (note the dash between ONE and 425)

See screenshot.
fields.summary: "Builds" link in commit history points to wrong URL on popup dialog

fields.description:
Please provide a way (via polling or hook) to trigger a build-plan when a new binary is detected in an Artifactory Pro repository.

I need to this to integrate release packages created by a third-party vendor in their own system, with our Bamboo system.

(TeamCity provides this functionality. Jenkins has a workaround that achieves this.)

Note: There is a open request to support a workaround for the lack of this feature: BAM-17404
fields.summary: Bamboo builds triggered by changes in a JFrog Artifactory Pro repository
Export warning is unclear

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When creating a release we would like to be able to see the artifact name displayed in the selectVersionForExecute.action view. Currently when a release is created it is unknown what the artifact name is and have to open the build result page.

!selectVersionForExecute.png|thumbanil!

h3. Suggested Resolution
Add name(s) of the artifacts associated with build reslut to be deployed in the selectVersionForExecute.action view
fields.summary: Add name(s) of the artifacts associated with build reslut in the selectVersionForExecute.action view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is currently possible to set the maximum number of elastic agents that can be running concurrently inside the *Elastic Bamboo configuration* page, according to the [Configuring Elastic Bamboo - Global settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+Elastic+Bamboo#ConfiguringElasticBamboo-Globalsettings] documentation. However this is a general configuration and doesn't take into account any of the instance's specification.
h3. Suggestion

It would be nice to have the ability to set the maximum number of elastic agents that can be running concurrently based off of the AMI id.

For example: If the *Maximum number of elastic agents* configuration is set to 5, the user can start 5 elastic agents based on the Windows stock image, but what if we want to limit the maximum number of *Windows stock images* users can start up concurrently? It's not possible to trim down the number of *specific* images that can be running at the same time without affecting other images.
fields.summary: Maximum number of elastic agents based on AMI id

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Bamboo is running the same query twice to retrieve shared artifacts
* The query used to retrieve shared artifacts is inefficient, resulting in performance issues.
* One symptom is the inability to edit any task because the edit window is never displayed. After some minutes, an error message is displayed indicating that a 500 internal error occurred. 

h3. Environment
* Bamboo v5.8.1
* Bamboo v5.12.3.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# enable the following logs under "{{<bamboo-install>/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}}":
{code}
## log hibernate prepared statements/SQL queries (equivalent to setting 'hibernate.show_sql' to 'true')
log4j.category.org.hibernate.SQL=DEBUG
## log hibernate prepared statement parameter values
log4j.category.org.hibernate.type=TRACE
{code}
# restart Bamboo
# create a Project / Plan to publish *shared* artifact
# create a Deployment / Environment to consume the artifact above generated
# in both testing instances (_v5.8.1_ and _v5.12.3.1_) Bamboo is running the same queries when selecting the Artifact download task in {{deploy/config/configureEnvironmentTasks.action?environmentId=?}}
{code:sql}
select ARTIFACT_DEFINITION.*
 from ARTIFACT_DEFINITION
 cross join CHAIN_STAGE 
 where (ARTIFACT_DEFINITION.PRODUCER_JOB_ID in (select BUILD.BUILD_ID from BUILD BUILD where CHAIN_STAGE.STAGE_ID=BUILD.STAGE_ID)) 
   and ARTIFACT_DEFINITION.CHAIN_ARTIFACT=true
   and CHAIN_STAGE.BUILD_ID=?
{code}
{code:sql}
select ARTIFACT_SUBSCRIPTION.*
  from ARTIFACT_SUBSCRIPTION 
 where ARTIFACT_DEFINITION_ID=?
{code}
{code:sql}
select ARTIFACT_DEFINITION.*
 from ARTIFACT_DEFINITION
 cross join CHAIN_STAGE 
 where (ARTIFACT_DEFINITION.PRODUCER_JOB_ID in (select BUILD.BUILD_ID from BUILD BUILD where CHAIN_STAGE.STAGE_ID=BUILD.STAGE_ID)) 
   and ARTIFACT_DEFINITION.CHAIN_ARTIFACT=true
   and CHAIN_STAGE.BUILD_ID=?
{code}

h3. Expected Results
* Bamboo should run the query only once
* The query should be more efficient
{code:sql}
bsp26194=# EXPLAIN ANALYZE SELECT artifact_definition_id, 
                                  label, 
                                  src_directory, 
                                  copy_pattern, 
                                  chain_artifact,
                                  producer_job_id
                             FROM artifact_definition a,
                                  build j,
                                  chain_stage s
                            where a.producer_job_id = j.build_id                                                                                                                                                                       and j.stage_id =  s.stage_id
                              and s.build_id = '423264464';
                                                                     QUERY PLAN                                                                     
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Nested Loop  (cost=78.77..344.96 rows=29 width=85) (actual time=1.878..15.909 rows=182 loops=1)
   ->  Hash Join  (cost=78.49..333.59 rows=27 width=8) (actual time=1.448..13.223 rows=94 loops=1)
         Hash Cond: (j.stage_id = s.stage_id)
         ->  Seq Scan on build j  (cost=0.00..226.24 rows=7624 width=16) (actual time=0.016..8.716 rows=7624 loops=1)
         ->  Hash  (cost=78.30..78.30 rows=15 width=8) (actual time=1.327..1.327 rows=15 loops=1)
               Buckets: 1024  Batches: 1  Memory Usage: 1kB
               ->  Seq Scan on chain_stage s  (cost=0.00..78.30 rows=15 width=8) (actual time=0.557..1.320 rows=15 loops=1)
                     Filter: (build_id = 423264464::bigint)
                     Rows Removed by Filter: 3449
   ->  Index Scan using art_def_producer_idx on artifact_definition a  (cost=0.29..0.40 rows=2 width=85) (actual time=0.026..0.027 rows=2 loops=94)
         Index Cond: (producer_job_id = j.build_id)
 Planning time: 278.499 ms
 Execution time: 16.925 ms
(13 rows)
{code}

h3. Actual Results
* From the Bamboo logs on testing environments we have:

fields.description: Users are currently able to see the status of every Bamboo Build Agent, but they're not able to see the summary screen. Since there is no information displayed on the Agents Summary that users are not able to see elsewhere, it would make sense that they'd be able to view the summary.
fields.summary: Allow Users to See Agents Summary Screen

fields.description:
h4. Summary

The Plan Summary page displays an incorrect value (i.e. stage X of Y) for the number of stages, Y.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create plan with 3 stages
# Make 2 stages manual and add some long running tasks inside
# Start build
# Then start one of the manual stages

Note the project structure:
 !Capture 2016-07-05 at 14.48.43.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Expected Results

Plan summary page should display in parentheses:

{quote}stage 2 of 3{quote}

h4. Actual Results
Plan summary page displays:
{quote}stage 2 of 1{quote}
 !Capture 2016-07-05 at 14.47.12.png|thumbnail! 


h4. Notes
The reason is at 
com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.build.StageJsonDecorator
{code}
totalStages = chainExecution.getStages().size();
{code}
chainExecution has only current stage
fields.summary: Stages count is wrong when manual stage is building

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Failed Builds And First Successful" notification will always notify on initial successful build of a plan / branch.

From the documentation:
{quote}
Bamboo will send a notification whenever:
- a build of this plan fails.
- the plan is 'fixed' (that is, the plan's latest build is successful and the previous plan build failed).
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create Plan / stage / task
* Add notification "Failed Builds And First Successful"
* Set branch notifications to Use plans settings
* Create plan branch
* Build

h3. Expected Results
* Only notifies when 
** a build of this plan fails.
** the plan is 'fixed' (that is, the plan's latest build is successful and the previous plan build failed).

h3. Actual Results
Notifies when:
* a build of this plan fails.
* the plan is 'fixed' (that is, the plan's latest build is successful and the previous plan build failed).
* also notifies on the initial build (#1) even if its successful
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Failed Builds And First Successful notification always notifies on initial build of plan / branch

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove any native git capabilities from Bamboo so built-in JGit is used instead
# Set up a plan with a linked repository to Bitbucket Cloud, using generic Git as the repository type instead of Bitbucket Cloud (so auth is performed over SSH)
# Run the build

The build checkout task should succeed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We'd like to automate adding new agents and authenticating them with the Bamboo master. There is token verification, but it still seems to require a human logging in to the interface and clicking to approve each agent. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to disable remote agent authentication
fields.summary: Add the ability to disable remote agent authentication

fields.description:
h3. Summary
All users with Plan edit permission have the permissions to create repositories under {{Plan configuration >> Repositories}} tab

h3. Environment
* Bamboo v5.11.x
* Bamboo v5.12.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# log in to Bamboo with a user with *Admin* or *Create repository* Global Permission
# create a "{{Linked repository}}" under "{{Bamboo administration >> Build resources}}"
# create a new user (_i.e.: user.linked_)
# create a new group (_i.e.: bamboo-linked_) and add user above to this group
# grant all Plan permissions to the user and/or group cretaed
# logout from Bamboo
# log back in using *user.linked* user
# go to "{{Plan configuration >> Repositories}}" tab and "{{Create a repository}}"
(i) At this stage you are only able to select from existing Linked repositories
# save the repository
# edit the repository
(i) Now, you are able to change the repository configuration by selecting not only Linked repositories but also:
* Bitbucket Server / Stash
* Bitbucket Cloud
* CVS
* Subversion
* Perforce
* Git
* GitHub
* Mercurial

h3. Expected Results
Should only be able to select from Linked Repositories

h3. Actual Results
Can edit repository configuration to whatever repository after saving then editing repository.

h3.Workaround
No workaround available.
fields.summary: Any user with Plan edit permission can create repositories

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After updating notification recipient (user), the UI does not reflect the updated information until after a restart

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a notification with a _user_ type recipient. 
# Edit the notification and change the user

h3. Expected Results
The UI should show the new updated user recipient.

h3. Actual Results
The old user recipient is still shown. The UI only get updated with a restart. The notification still follows the updated recipient despite the UI showing the old recipient.
fields.summary: Updated notification recipient does not show in UI until after a restart

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Exception message for setup test method isn't shown in Bamboo with TestNG Parser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a testng-results.xml with setup test methods failing (i.e. those marked as is-config=”true”)
# Use TestNG Parser to parse the testng-results.xml

h3. Expected Results
The exception message is shown in Bamboo

h3. Actual Results
The exception message isn't shown in Bamboo. It is just showing test method and class name as failure.
fields.summary: TestNG Result parser does not show exception message for setup test methods failure

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the CodeDeploy task seems to only have one concurrent request (zip) for uploading packages to bucket
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to increase concurrent request to upload packages to bucket
fields.summary: I want to increase concurrent request for uploading packages using CodeDeploy task

fields.description:
Otherwise you run into strange situation when you can't deploy a release even though all the pieces are there.
By "protected from expiry" we mean:
- not expired because of "minimum builds to keep" feature
- not expired because of "keep builds with labels" feature

*Workaround*:
 - disable expiry
 - increase the expiry time
 - increase number of releases to keep
fields.summary: If a build result is protected from expiry,  the related release should also be protected from expiry.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Git and Mercurial server capabilities should not contain value in it while adding. Now it has predefined values in it what looks like something built in in bamboo will be used, and it may cause an errors during plan executions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to  Bamboo administration -> Server capabilities.
2. Try to add Git or Mercurial capability.

h3. Expected results
Field path should be empty as in any other capability.

h3. Actual results
Field path contain text (looks like variable, see screenshots) and may prevent user to provide a path. Saving as it is will cause to errors in plan executions.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Git and Mercurial server capabilities should not contain value in it while adding

fields.description:
Sometimes, one needs to change a Bamboo build plan for a repository, as project development is progressing, etc., in a way that effectively breaks building on older branches.

This makes it hard or impossible to re-build old branches, that depend on an earlier version of the Bamboo build plan.

Wouldn't it be really, really cool, if Bamboo's build plans could be stored in the code repository, so that the build plan of a project is always kept with the project? 
This would make everyone able to re-build old branches without manually changing the build plans (and changing them back, when done) - an error-prone practice.

If anyone knows of another way to 'fix' this, please inform.
fields.summary: Store Bamboo build plans in code repository, with the code

fields.description:
Create some variables in Plan configuration:
!1.png|thumbnail!
Notice that at the far right of the variable + value a delete (x) icon is shown.

Add a variable that has a value of 100 characters:
!2.png|thumbnail!

When hovering over the 100_char value field, the content spills over the field.
Harmless, but looks sloppy:
!3.png|thumbnail!

Now add a variable with a value of 200 characters.
The delete icon is no longer shown for any of the variables:
!4.png|thumbnail!

If you want to delete a variable, clicking on its value is of no use.
The delete icon doesn't show up:
!5.png|thumbnail!

Only if you click on the long 200_char variable value, the delete icons for all variables, except 200_char itself, is shown again:
!6.png|thumbnail!

To delete the 200_char variable, you first need to change its value to a shorter one:
!7.png|thumbnail!

The delete icon then shows up for 200_char also, and you can delete it:
!8.png|thumbnail!

That workaround doesn't work if you have more than one long variable value...
!9.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Long variable values corrupt variables configuration screen

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Identify a plan that currently has failing tests.
# Configure it to send you emails for "All Builds Completed".
# Run the plan.

h3. Actual result

When the notification email is received, there will be
* no tests listed under the "Tests" section, and
* there are two broken links: The "Tests" heading itself and the "View full test details" link both link to "com.atlassian.bamboo.chains.ChainFilteredTestResult=
s@747350f2/browse/UPGRADE-SMOKE-225/test"

h3. Expected result

There should be a listing of all the broken tests under the "Tests" heading and the "Tests" heading and the "View full test details" link should be valid links that point back to the relevant build result test summary page on the Bamboo instance.

We first had a report of this problem after our upgrade from 5.11.0-m369 to 5.12.0-m427. We are still experiencing it in 5.13.0-m533.
fields.summary: Failing tests in notification emails not listed, broken links

fields.description:
h3. Summary

According to the [NUnit Parser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/NUnit+Parser] documentation, Bamboo uses XML reports produced by NUnit to report and track the history of the tests. According to the XML file, we have a total of {{838}} tests:

{noformat}
name="" total="838" errors="8" failures="15" not-run="16" inconclusive="0" ignored="16" skipped="0" invalid="0"
{noformat}

When looking at the build logs, we can also see the total count reporting {{838}} tests:

{noformat}
build	23-May-2016 19:49:26	  Test Run Summary
build	23-May-2016 19:49:26	    Overall result: Failed
build	23-May-2016 19:49:26	    Test Count: 838, Passed: 799, Failed: 23, Inconclusive: 0, Skipped: 16
build	23-May-2016 19:49:26	      Failed Tests - Failures: 15, Errors: 8, Invalid: 0
build	23-May-2016 19:49:26	      Skipped Tests - Ignored: 16, Explicit: 0, Other: 0
build	23-May-2016 19:49:26	    Start time: 2016-05-24 01:49:21Z
build	23-May-2016 19:49:26	      End time: 2016-05-24 01:49:26Z
build	23-May-2016 19:49:26	      Duration: 5.320 seconds
build	23-May-2016 19:49:26	  
build	23-May-2016 19:49:26	  Results (nunit2) saved as TestResults.xml
{noformat}

However, once the build finishes, Bamboo displays the following information in the *Build result summary* page:

{noformat}
total="752" failures="22" not-run="16"
{noformat}

The problem is that the NUnit parser counts the number of tests based on the test case name from the XML report. If there are duplicated test case names, as seen in the example below, Bamboo will not take them into account.

{noformat}
<test-suite type="ParameterizedTest" name="IsEncounterInpatient_Tests" executed="True" result="Success" success="True" time="0.088" asserts="0">
  <results>
    <test-case name="HRP.EDS.DVE.Lib.EditsV1.Tests.Unit.EditHandling.DynamicEdits.DataValidationHelperTests.Professional, P" executed="True" result="Success" success="True" time="0.066" asserts="1" />
    <test-case name="HRP.EDS.DVE.Lib.EditsV1.Tests.Unit.EditHandling.DynamicEdits.DataValidationHelperTests.Institutional, I" executed="True" result="Success" success="True" time="0.000" asserts="1" />
    <test-case name="HRP.EDS.DVE.Lib.EditsV1.Tests.Unit.EditHandling.DynamicEdits.DataValidationHelperTests.Professional, I" executed="True" result="Success" success="True" time="0.000" asserts="1" />
    <test-case name="HRP.EDS.DVE.Lib.EditsV1.Tests.Unit.EditHandling.DynamicEdits.DataValidationHelperTests.Institutional, P" executed="True" result="Success" success="True" time="0.000" asserts="1" />
  </results>
</test-suite>
<test-suite type="ParameterizedTest" name="IsEncounterOutpatient_Tests" executed="True" result="Success" success="True" time="0.004" asserts="0">
  <results>
    <test-case name="HRP.EDS.DVE.Lib.EditsV1.Tests.Unit.EditHandling.DynamicEdits.DataValidationHelperTests.Professional, P" executed="True" result="Success" success="True" time="0.000" asserts="1" />
    <test-case name="HRP.EDS.DVE.Lib.EditsV1.Tests.Unit.EditHandling.DynamicEdits.DataValidationHelperTests.Professional, I" executed="True" result="Success" success="True" time="0.000" asserts="1" />
    <test-case name="HRP.EDS.DVE.Lib.EditsV1.Tests.Unit.EditHandling.DynamicEdits.DataValidationHelperTests.Institutional, P" executed="True" result="Success" success="True" time="0.000" asserts="1" />
    <test-case name="HRP.EDS.DVE.Lib.EditsV1.Tests.Unit.EditHandling.DynamicEdits.DataValidationHelperTests.Institutional, I" executed="True" result="Success" success="True" time="0.000" asserts="1" />
  </results>
</test-suite>
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

Bamboo should be able to parse and display the correct results even if there are duplicated test case names.

h3. Actual Results

Bamboo does not parse duplicated test case names. The results displayed in the *Build result summary* page differs from the XML report.
fields.summary: NUnit parser doesn't display correct results due to duplicated test case names

fields.description:
*Bamboo* had a resource that deserialised input from build agents and did not sufficiently restrict which classes could be deserialised. To exploit this issue, attackers need to have a valid *Bamboo* agent fingerprint or be able to run code on a *Bamboo* agent.

*Affected versions:*
* All versions of *Bamboo* from 2.3.1 before 5.11.4.1 (the fixed version for 5.11.x) and from 5.12.0 before 5.12.3.1 (the fixed version for 5.12.x) are affected by this vulnerability.

\\
*Fix:*
* Bamboo 5.12.3.1 is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/download.
* Bamboo 5.11.4.1 is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/download-archives.


\\
*Acknowledgements:*
We would like to credit Moritz Bechler of AgNO3 for reporting this issue to us.

\\
For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/rSGSMQ].
fields.summary: CVE-2016-5229 - Deserialisation resulting in remote code execution caused by insufficient restriction on permitted deserialised classes

<issue key="TEST-1" summary="DESCRIPTION" iconUrl="..." issueType="Sub-task" status="Done" statusClass="done" assignee="...">

Step to reproduce:

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a plan
# Create a new global Bitbucket Server/Stash repository pointed to some branch
# Go to Edit Repository -> Advanced options -> Include / exclude files
# Choose 'Exclude all changes that match to the following pattern'
# Enter a file pattern for your directory, e.g. sub/directory/*
# Set up Remote trigger to trigger the build when changes are committed
# Commit to the sub/directory/ 

h3. Expected results
Check that the commit to the directory doesn't trigger the plan
h3. Actual results
The commit to the directory triggers the plan

h3. Notes
- It's also impossible to include the specific directory choosing 'Include only changes that match to the following pattern' so that the build is triggered only after changes made to that repository. That setting also does not have any effect.
- I also found out that other people came accross the same issue according to https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/257995/is-there-a-way-to-trigger-a-bamboo-build-on-changes-to-a-specific-sub-directory-of-a-git-repository
fields.summary: Include / exclude files option in Bamboo doesn't have an effect after applying it

{noformat}org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: E160006: No such revision 5
svn: E175002: PROPFIND of '/svn/external1/!svn/vcc/default': 500 Internal Server Error (https://192.168.56.101){noformat}

# Plan 2: configure the SVN repository to have *Detect changes on externals* true (advanced options)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently it's possible to have Bamboo automatically link a plan branch to a JIRA issue if the branch name contains a JIRA issue key or something similar to a JIRA issue key. This feature is described with more details inside the following documentation:

- [Using plan branches - Integrating branches with JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Using+plan+branches#Usingplanbranches-IntegratingbrancheswithJIRAapplications]

The problem is that there's no validation. If Bamboo understands that the branch name contains something similar to a JIRA issue key, it creates a link to JIRA even if no JIRA issue exists with that key, and if you simply want to remove that association, you are not able to because there's no option in the UI that provides such ability. It would be nice if Bamboo could check and identify if the JIRA issue exists before creating the link.

Once you turn this feature off new branches will no longer be automatically associated to JIRA issues, however existing plan branches will remain linked to JIRA issues (even if the JIRA issue doesn't exist) and there's no way to remove the link from the UI.

h3.Workaround

It is possible to remove the link directly from the database. Please [raise a support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com] for Bamboo and mention this bug report so that the Atlassian Support Team can help you remove the links from the database.
fields.summary: JIRA feature branches does not validate if JIRA issue exists

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to "Build Docker image" from Docker task

h3. Resolution
Problem is fixed in Bamboo 5.13.0.1. In case you can't upgrade please download bamboo-docker-plugin 5.10.3 from https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/bamboo-docker-plugin/downloads and install it in Bamboo via Administration / Manage addons

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Docker
# Set the docker capability on Bamboo
# Create a plan and add the docker task to it
# Set the docker task configuration as the following:
!bamboo.docker.task-dockerForMac.png|thumbnail!
# Run the build

h3. Expected Results
The new image is built and added to the image repository.

h3. Actual Results
When running Bamboo's Docker task, the following error gets thrown.
{noformat:title=build log}
error	04-Jul-2016 19:35:54	invalid argument "\"ubuntu:latest\"" for --tag="ubuntu:latest": Error parsing reference: "\"ubuntu:latest\"" is not a valid repository/tag

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, there is no way to tell when was the latest date/time a user logged in Bamboo, regardless the authentication type (_e.g.: Internal Directory, External Directory_)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# When authenticating in Bamboo (_Internal Directory_), there is no database table that holds information on user's latest authentication against the application.
# When authenticating in Bamboo (_External Directory, e.g.: JIRA_) you can run the following SQL statement against JIRA's database:
{code:sql}
select Attr.attribute_value as LAST_AUTHENTICATED
  from cwd_user as Person
  join cwd_user_attributes as Attr
       on Person.id = Attr.user_id
 where Person.user_name = 'USERNAME'
   and Attr.attribute_name = 'lastAuthenticated';
{code}
||LAST_AUTHENTICATED||
|1467639110107|
However, when authenticating with the same USERNAME in JIRA and re-running the SQL statement above, the same gets updated:
||LAST_AUTHENTICATED||
|1467639474640|
(i) Due to the information above, you cannot tell whether the authentication was from Bamboo or JIRA.

h3. Expected Results
Be able to determine when a particular last authenticate against the application.

h3. Actual Results
Information cannot be retrieved.

h3. Notes
In Bamboo, there is a table "{{AUTH_ATTEMPT_INFO}}" that stores failure login attempts.
||id||USER_NAME||AUTH_COUNT||LAST_AUTH_TIMESTAMP||
|4030465|USERNAME|0|2016-07-04|
This table could store information related to not only failure login attempts but actual login as well.
(i) {{LAST_AUTH_TIMESTAMP}} should store date/time.

h3.Workaround
Last login date can be pulled from log files, such as {{<bamboo-install>/logs/catalina.out}} using a shell command. The command below, tested on Unix machines, allows for multiple {{catalina.out}} files in multiple directories, for example in the case of upgrades:
{code}
find / -name catalina.out -exec grep "Finished doing authentication checks for" {} \; |awk -F ' ' 'BEGIN {date = $1} {if ($1 > date && $1 > a[$11]) a[$11] = $1} END {for (i in a) print i" : " a[i]}'
{code}
Sample output:
{noformat}
nonadmin, : 2017-02-15
bamboo, : 2017-02-24
{noformat}
Notes:
# The command provided will only work on terminals which support GNU tools
# This can be run from any directory accessible by the Bamboo user
# This command may take some time to run, dependent on the size of your {{catalina.out}} file(s)
# This suggestion is provided as-is and support will not be available from Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Get last timestamp users authenticated in Bamboo and from where

fields.description:
h4. Problem

Bamboo 5.10 introduced a new interface method [RuntimeTaskDataProvider#createRuntimeTaskData()|https://docs.atlassian.com/bamboo/5.10.0/com/atlassian/bamboo/task/RuntimeTaskDataProvider.html#createRuntimeTaskData-com.atlassian.bamboo.task.runtime.RuntimeTaskDefinition-com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.CommonContext-]. This is supposed to be backwards compatible, thus optional regarding an implementing class:

bq. Server side pre-build action that may be implemented by task. \[...\]

However, the respective calling code in {{com.atlassian.bamboo.chains.ChainPluginSupportHelper}} looks like this:

{code}
try
{
    taskDefinition.setRuntimeData(runtimeConfigurator.createRuntimeTaskData(taskDefinition, commonContext));
}
catch (IncompatibleClassChangeError e)
{
    log.info("Old plugin interface detected: ", e);
}
{code}

(i) This results in something like the following being written to the Bamboo server log _every time a task using a pre 5.10 RuntimeTaskDataProvider gets executed:_

{noformat}

	at com.atlassian.bamboo.chains.ChainPluginSupportHelper.prepareRuntimeTaskData(ChainPluginSupportHelper.java:43)

	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:190)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:157)

	at com.atlassian.bamboo.chains.ChainExecutionManagerImpl.delayedStart(ChainExecutionManagerImpl.java:239)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)

	at com.atlassian.bamboo.util.CacheAwareness$3.call(CacheAwareness.java:134)

	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper$1.run(ImpersonationHelper.java:52)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

h4. Impact

While these log entries _could_ be safely ignored (as indicated by the INFO level), they usually aren't - (!) We had several support requests and bug reports filed against [our add-ons|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/vendors/772927] due to this log pollution already, where totally unrelated problems got attributed to our code at first, as those repetitive stack traces stand out and hinder the search for the actual cause.

h4. Proposed Fix

Adjust the {{log.info("Old plugin interface detected: ", e);}} call to exclude the exception and use a respectively enhanced log message for the intended developer hint instead.

We removed username and passwd lines and added encryption jar files in lib folder.

{code:html}
   <property name="hibernate.connection.datasource">java:comp/env/jdbc/bambooDS</property>
{code}

   <property name="hibernate.connection.password">Password</property>
    <property name="hibernate.connection.url">jdbc:oracle:thin:@server.xxx.xxx.gov:port:sid</property>

{code:java}
29-Jun-2016 14:46:05.090 SEVERE [main] org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol.destroy Failed to destroy end point associated with ProtocolHandler ["http-nio-10085"]

Satya.

fields.description:
MStest is now considered a legacy tool within the .NET developer community, VStest has been developed to replace the unit test runner within Visual Studio and is the de facto standard for Visual Studio 2013 or newer.

Bamboo still does provide a "VStest Runner" Task to facilitate the easy adoption of this tool, forcing teams to script the process themselves and invoke that script from Bamboo, a very disjointed and inelegant process.

What we need is a Task type that will invoke VSTest (fundamentally similar to MSTest) and then parse the results file (fundamentally identical to the existing MSTest parser and MSTest runner tasks).
fields.summary: Provide a VSTest Runner to obsolete the MSTest Runner

fields.description:
I have tried to add Gatekeeper merge with auto push on success to some existing projects.
When creating a new branch, the build is triggered as expected and passes green, but no push is performed, and never mentioned in UI or log.

I then created an entire new "helloworld" project referencing a new helloworld" bitbucket server repo, with a minimal build plan (print dir), everything worked fine. We noticed the difference that the new plan had automatically created a "linked repo".  Inspired by this, we tried changing the original real plan to  "linked repository", but it still failed.

We then instead created a new Bamboo project against the same original repo (now as linked) and then it works as expected and does the push at the end.

I can find no obvious difference between the modified original bamboo project and the new one created against the same source repository.

(During the debugging of this problem, I was also very surprised that the push, whether succesful or not, is never mentioned at all in the build log - but this might be a topic for a separate issue).
fields.summary: Adding Gatekeeper to existing projects silently skips push

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Disable XSRF checks on HTTP GET methods" setting doesn't saved in proper state via changes via UI. Issue is UI related mostly as it shouldn't affect functionally. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Security settings ->Check:  "Enable XSRF protection", "Disable XSRF checks on HTTP GET methods”. Save.
2. Uncheck: "Disable XSRF checks on HTTP GET methods”. Save.
     Audit logs: xsrfAllowsMutativeGets  \[true]  \[false]
3. Uncheck: "Enable XSRF protection”. Save.
     Audit logs:
     xsrfProtectionEnabled \[true]  \[false]
     xsrfAllowsMutativeGets  \[false] \[true]
4. Check:
"Enable XSRF protection”. Save.
     Audit logs:
     xsrfProtectionEnabled \[false] \[true]
     xsrfAllowsMutativeGets  \[true]  \[false]

h3. Expected results
At step 3 -  xsrfAllowsMutativeGets shouldn’t be enabled.

h3. Actual results
At step 3 - xsrfAllowsMutativeGets is set to enabled.

h3. Workaround
None

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm trying to use Bamboos API to extract some KPIs of my daily work.
Therefore I extracted allready the overall average queuetime of a plan.

As a counterpart to that KPI I wanted to extract the summed agent utilization as well.
Unfortunately (and I really don't get why), there is no real json representation so I've to extract the values from imageMap.

Thats working even though its ugly, but when I try to do the same for AgentUtilization, I get:
{Code}Unknown was utilized 147.0 seconds for January 2015{Code}

I would expect "_Unkown_ " to be sth like "_PROJECT-BUILD_". Or am I sth missing and Unknown is correct?

*Update*: I see its also not working in the shown image in the UI

*BTW*.: Even though this is fixed its still ugly. Is there already an open Feature Request, to return the report data as json?
fields.summary: Unknown instead of Plan Key in Utilization Report

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When Bamboo is restarted, the previously enabled token verification becomes disabled.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Bamboo Security token is not active.
2. Enable 'Enable security token verification'. Security token activated.
2.1 View URL to install a remote agent - it will have a "-t" option passed with a key.
3. Restart Bamboo web service
4. 'Enable security token verification' has reappeared. Security token is not active.
4.1 View URL to install agent - no "-t" or key is present.

h3. Expected Results

Enable security token verification maintains state.

h3. Actual Results

The security token verification is reset to disabled. 

h3. Workaround

Changing security token verification flag, have another admin save administration configuration on any other screen. Whole administration configuration will be saved including token verification flag. For example, go to the "Quarantine settings" and click save. (You don't have to change quarantine settings for it to work. We are just updating all the variables under the hood).
fields.summary: Enable security token verification disabled after restart

fields.description:
Hi, Bamboo team

My project is using a customized maven-invoker-plugin.

When I build my project from bamboo server command line, it can successfully build and it is downloading and use the customized plugin

When I build my project via bamboo planning 

1)Using Maven2 Atlassian Plugin of type 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.maven:task.builder.mvn2, but the executable path linked to mvn3.2.5, it can download my customized maven-invoker-plugin and successfully build the plan.

2)Using Maven3 Altassian Plugin of type 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.maven:task.builder.mvn3, the executable path linked to the same mvn3.2.5, it will download the regular maven-invoker-plugin:2.0.0, and failed to execute the task because the maven goal was not existing.


3)Using command line in bamboo plan (not using any atlassian plugin) to run the same goals, it can successfully run.

thanks
Yi Mei
fields.summary: com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.maven:task.builder.mvn3 changed the build behavior

fields.description: Right now when you try to put in a variable value for a build plan in a project the box you input the value in doesn't use word wrap. So if you need to put in a large key or string the box runs off the page when you hit enter. Simply adding word wrap to the fields using CSS should solve this issue.

fields.description:
The request:

For release versioning, allow the version that is set in the Release Versioning page to auto-populate when deploying from a branch that is not the default branch of the Build Plan. 

The reasoning:

We typically will release to our lower environment from our 'release' branch so this is the default plan branch. Occasionally, our dev team will manually deploy from the 'master' branch to our STG/INT environment. When choosing to deploy the environment, and then choosing "Create new release from build result" the "Release" field is auto-populated based on the variables in the Release-versioning setup. 

However if you update the plan branch to a different one, ie master, it defaults to branchname-buildnumber. I see that this is mentioned on the Release Versioning page ("Releases from branches will default to using the branch name suffixed with the build number of the build result."), but was wondering if there was a specific reasoning/purpose behind that as opposed to just auto-populating the format the users set on this page.

No urgency here. It's just a very minor nuisance that the dev team has complained about a few times so I figured I would toss in a ticket about it.
fields.summary: allow the version that is set in the Release Versioning page to auto-populate when deploying non-default branch

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users of this plugin sometimes need to carry out tasks for every build, regardless of which project or plan is being run. At present, there is no way to achieve a default set of actions globally without reconfiguring the required actions for every build plan

h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce a method to configure globally applicable actions

h3. Workaround
Manually set up actions for each plan
fields.summary: Allow Pre-Post Build Command Runner Global Default

fields.summary: Provide REST endpoint to retrieve storage tag for plans

fields.description:
h4. Problem
There is a global expiry option "Build and deployment result logs only" with the description "Logs under 10MB are always kept", but according to Bamboo source code we don't have 10MB constant and expiry logic looks at ExpiryCriteria.maxIgnoredLogSize which is -1 by default and there is no UI interface to update it.

The description should display the correct value of ignored log size from administration.xml with a link to KB showing how to change this value.

h4. Workaround
[Build expiry removes all logs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMKB/Build+expiry+removes+all+logs]
fields.summary: Expiry option description should be calculated

fields.description:
My scm repository is using perforce. Currently my plans could only be restricted on one agent because the same perforce view can't be sync into two different server.

So here is my idea
I can create each view per agent. For example 
default agent: default_view
Remote agent 1: agent1_view
Remote agent 2: agent2_view

Create key-value for each agent as below
default agent: bamboo.perforce.view ="default_view"
Remote agent 1: bamboo.perforce.view ="agent1_view"
Remote agent 2: bamboo.perforce.view ="agent2_view"

Then within plan configuration, I would like to use the key-value for plan repository configuration like below 

Client (workspace) : $ { bamboo.perforce.view}
Depot view: //$ { bamboo.perforce.view}/Main/...

When job is running on the different agent, it will get the running agent value for execution.

Same idea could be extended to other build variables.

thanks
Yi Mei
fields.summary: Agent key value can be used in plan configuration

fields.description:
We have many build projects and build plans which are no longer actively used, however we cannot delete them, because we might have to use them in the future e.g. in case we need to build a maintenance release.

The existing filter options allow to filter by project or label.

We would appreciate to have one of these potential improvements:

Option 1: Archive:
Allow to "archive" projects and/or build plans, which could be to move them to a 2nd "space" which is usually out of sight for Bamboo users. This "archive" could e.g. be accessible from an additional entry in Bamboo's main menu.

Option 2: Extend filter to exclude projects and plans with a defined label "Hidden":
Bamboo could come with a predefined, exclusive label "Hidden", that one can use to label expired projects and plans and that one can select in the filter option to exclude projects and plans from being shown in the regular list.

Note: We are currently using Bamboo 5.6, but I did not see such a feature in the release notes for the newer versions.
fields.summary: Archive or at least a filter to hide old and rarely used build projects and plans

fields.description:

All plans use the "Bitbucket server repository trigger".
Most of the plan/repo combinations work as expected, but some plans have large delays (1 day+) after a commit.
Just checked this again, I have a repo with a commit from yesterday, but the build is 6 days old. Commit was pushed to master. 
Tried to remove the trigger, and re-add it, but without effect.
Can someone give me directions how to debug this? I have access to the logs on bitbucket server and bamboo server.
fields.summary: Commits in Bitbucket Server do not trigger a Bamboo build (or with exorbitant delay)

fields.description:
=Problem=
Bamboo sometimes(not happened constantly, ~1 time from 10) hangs during installation on Windows (2008 R2). And it is needed to stop/start it to continue working. 

=Steps=
1. Install bamboo as a service on Windows. Start it.
2. Provide license, proceed with custom installation.
3. Select MS SQL as external database to use. (MS SQL 2014 was used). During DB setup firstly provide wrong credentials, and then provide correct one (looks like issue happened more frequent after that, but not for sure).
4. Wait until Bamboo configured DB.
5. At next screen provide admin username, pwd, and details, click save.

=Expected result=
Bamboo redirects user to the first plan creation screen.

=Actual result=
"Please wait while Bamboo finalises your setup" dialog is displayed for a long time (I was waiting > 30 minutes and then tried to reload page). See screenshot.

=Other=
See logs for details.
fields.summary: Bamboo sometimes hangs during installation on Windows

fields.description: One missing feature from bamboo and JIRA integration is that when we deploy with bamboo, we know how many issues are included in this build, it will be sweet to update the build number to JIRA to see which issue is included in which build. It will be great help for QA team to identity when an issue is ready to test in which env.
fields.summary: Update Bamboo build number in JIRA

fields.description:
Hi,

We just upgraded to Bamboo 5.12.2 and discovered that Altassian plans to remove the repositories settings at the build plans level. Already in version 5.12.2, our users cannot create their build plan repositories anymore because we did not grant them the Create Plan permission and will certainly not grant them that permission in the future.

The reason is we have one Bamboo instance that we share among hundreds of teams. This Bamboo is linked to a Confluence instance and a Jira instance. Applinks being what it is (instable); we are not found of multiplying instances (also it will bring more operation/maintenance work).

So this move of Atlassian to remove the repositories settings at the build plan level and require users to have the create plan permission is not fitting our model here:
- giving the Create Plan permission to all of our users will result in a mess in the way our build plans are created; grouped in projects, etc...
- as we cannot offload the repository settings to our users now, we have to handle this part

Any ways for Atlassian to revisit its motive to remove this feature (adding repositories at build plan level with out the Create Plan permission) ? Also it is not really logic. Why would you need a Create Plan permission (which is at the Bamboo global instance level) when you have the Admin permission of a given build plan ?

Thank you
fields.summary: Build plan repositories and Create Plan permission

fields.description:
Currently, I have a plan which is running against my development branch. There are some unresolved bugs linked to some tests.
These links are shared between builds on the same branch, but when Bamboo executes a build against other branches, using a plan branch, I can't see the linked JIRA issues on that branch.

I'd like some option to share these links, so I don't have to manually link the issues to failing builds every time.

Thanks
fields.summary: Share JIRA linked issues between plan branches

fields.description: Favicons were set to change on build status like in BAM-13759 and BAM-12064. It would be very helpful if the same concept was applied to the deployment status page.

I have a capture of the Bamboo server status, configuration, log files, etc. but it is ~300 Mb even with limiting file sizes, so if there's another channel I can use to get it to you, please let me know.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When applying a new license to Bamboo, the Maximum number of elastic agents in the elastic bamboo config is reset back to "5".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Bamboo Admin >> Elastic Bamboo >> Configuration >> Edit Configuration*
# Under *Elastic Agents* change the Maximum number of elastic agents to 1
# Go to *Bamboo Admin >> System >> License details* and apply a new license (or re-apply the same license)


h3. Expected Results
Maximum number of elastic agents should remain set to the specified value (*1* in this example)

h3. Actual Results
Maximum number of elastic agents is reset back to the default value of *5*

h3.Workaround
The max number of agents needs to be manually set again after applying a new license
fields.summary: Maximum number of elastic agents is reset when applying new license

fields.description:
There is a limitation of Bamboo where you simply cannot operate from a local user directory and a Crowd user directory at the same time. This is in contrast to the other Atlassian applications where both local & crowd user directories can be selected to both allow authentication in the one application.

I have set up Atlassian Apps such as Crowd, Bitbucket & Jira with Crowd set up for Single sign-on and user identity across the Apps. Each App has been set up with a local admin account in order to have a local account for set up and configuration and also to get access to the app if the Crowd Service goes down. However, this is not possible with Bamboo so we have had to rely solely on Crowd for access Bamboo.
fields.summary: Bamboo Can't Operate with Local Users and Crowd Users
